xterm.notes: VT100 feature, supported since earliest versions

iterm2.notes: Bold attribute (SGR 1) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_BOLD in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2113. Sets ATTR_BOLD flag.

xterm.notes: ECMA-48 2nd edition feature, requires OPT_WIDE_ATTRS

iterm2.notes: Dim/faint attribute (SGR 2) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_FAINT in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2114. Sets ATTR_DIM flag.

xterm.notes: ECMA-48 2nd edition feature, requires OPT_WIDE_ATTRS

iterm2.notes: Italic attribute (SGR 3) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_ITALIC in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2121. Sets ATTR_ITALIC flag.

xterm.notes: VT100 feature, supported since earliest versions

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:95-123, supports extended underline styles via SGR 4:n

iterm2.notes: Underline (SGR 4) fully supported with multiple styles via sub-parameters including single, double, curly, dotted, and dashed.

konsole.notes: SGR 4 sets RE_UNDERLINE, supports subparameters for different underline styles

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2122-2124. Sets ATTR_UNDER flag.

xterm.notes: VT100 feature, both SGR 5 and 6 map to BLINK

ghostty.notes: Both slow and rapid blink map to same blink attribute

iterm2.notes: Slow blink (SGR 5) supported via VT100CHARATTR_BLINK. iTerm2 does not distinguish between slow and rapid blink rates.

vte.notes: Both slow and rapid blink map to same blink attribute

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2146. Sets ATTR_BLINK flag.

xterm_js.notes: Both slow and rapid blink map to same flag

xterm.notes: Treated same as slow blink, both map to BLINK

ghostty.notes: Both slow and rapid blink map to same blink attribute

kitty.notes: SGR 6 not implemented, treated same as SGR 5

foot.notes: Explicitly logged as ignored at csi.c:126

iterm2.notes: Rapid blink (SGR 6) treated the same as slow blink (SGR 5). No distinction made between blink rates.

vte.notes: Both slow and rapid blink map to same blink attribute

windows_terminal.notes: SGR 6 treated as alias of slow blink (SGR 5)

konsole.notes: No separate rapid blink; SGR 6 not implemented, only SGR 5 (slow blink)

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2147. Sets ATTR_BLINK2 flag.

xterm_js.notes: Not implemented; SGR 5 slow blink is used instead

xterm.notes: VT100 feature, supported since earliest versions

iterm2.notes: Reverse video (SGR 7) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_REVERSE in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2148. Sets ATTR_REVERSE flag.

xterm.notes: ECMA-48 2nd/VT300 feature

iterm2.notes: Hidden/invisible text (SGR 8) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_INVISIBLE in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2149. Sets ATTR_INVISIBLE flag.

xterm.notes: ECMA-48 3rd edition feature, requires OPT_WIDE_ATTRS

iterm2.notes: Strikethrough (SGR 9) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_STRIKETHROUGH in VT100GraphicRendition structure.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2156. Sets ATTR_STRIKEOUT flag.

xterm.notes: ECMA-48 3rd edition feature, requires OPT_WIDE_ATTRS

iterm2.notes: Double underline (SGR 21) fully supported via VT100CHARATTR_DOUBLE_UNDERLINE and VT100UnderlineStyleDouble.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2182-2184. Sets ATTR_DOUBLYUND flag. Also available via SGR 4:2 subparameter at src/termout.c:2133-2135.

xterm.notes: Not implemented in xterm

foot.notes: No case for SGR 53 found in code

iterm2.notes: Overline (SGR 53) not implemented for text rendering. Code 53 is used for DSR locator status reporting, not overline.

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2202. Sets ATTR_OVERL flag.

xterm.notes: Not implemented in xterm

ghostty.notes: Supports curly, dotted, and dashed underline styles via SGR 4:3, 4:4, 4:5

foot.notes: Implemented at csi.c:112 via SGR 4:3, part of extended underline styles

iterm2.notes: Curly/wavy underline (SGR 4:3) fully supported via VT100UnderlineStyleCurly with sub-parameter syntax in VT100GraphicRendition.

vte.notes: Supports underline styles 0-5: none, single, double, curly, dotted, dashed via SGR 4:n subparameters

windows_terminal.notes: SGR 4:3 sets curly underline style via sub-parameters

konsole.notes: SGR 4:3 sets RE_UNDERLINE_CURL via subparameter handling

mintty.notes: Implemented at src/termout.c:2136-2138. Uses SGR 4:3 subparameter to set ATTR_CURLYUND flag.

xterm.notes: No evidence of SGR 4:4 support. Only basic underline (SGR 4) and double underline (SGR 21) are implemented

foot.notes: SGR 4:4, enum UNDERLINE_DOTTED in terminal.h:113, csi.c:102-119

alacritty.notes: SGR 4:4 - DOTTED_UNDERLINE flag defined in cell.rs:31

vte.notes: SGR 4:4 supported via subparameter handling in sgr.hh

konsole.notes: RE_UNDERLINE_DOT (value 4) handled via SGR 4:4 in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:596,2040

mintty.notes: SGR 4:4 implemented at termout.c:2139-2141, mapped to ATTR_BROKENUND, rendered as PS_DOT

xterm.notes: No evidence of SGR 4:5 support. Only basic underline (SGR 4) and double underline (SGR 21) are implemented

foot.notes: SGR 4:5, enum UNDERLINE_DASHED in terminal.h:114, csi.c:102-119

alacritty.notes: SGR 4:5 - DASHED_UNDERLINE flag defined in cell.rs:32

vte.notes: SGR 4:5 supported via subparameter handling in sgr.hh

konsole.notes: RE_UNDERLINE_DASH (value 5) handled via SGR 4:5 in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:596,2040

mintty.notes: SGR 4:5 implemented at termout.c:2142-2144, mapped to ATTR_BROKENUND | ATTR_DOUBLYUND, rendered as PS_DASH

xterm.notes: SGR 30-37, 40-47 documented as VT100. SGR 90-97, 100-107 require OPT_AIX_COLORS compile flag

konsole.notes: Full support for SGR 30-37, 40-47, 90-97, 100-107 in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:2064-2110

mintty.notes: SGR 30-37, 40-47, 90-97, 100-107 fully implemented at termout.c:2195-2265

xterm.notes: SGR 38;5;n / 48;5;n supported when compiled with 256-color support

wezterm.notes: Implemented via SGR 38;5;n / 48;5;n with both semicolon and colon separators - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/csi.rs:2552-2567

vte.notes: SGR 38;5;n and 48;5;n supported in collect_sgr_color function

mintty.notes: SGR 38;5;n and 48;5;n fully implemented at termout.c:2208-2271

xterm.notes: SGR 38;2;r;g;b supported for compatibility with KDE konsole. Requires OPT_DIRECT_COLOR for true 24-bit, otherwise uses closest palette match

alacritty.notes: SGR 38;2;r;g;b - parsed by vte crate v0.15.0

vte.notes: SGR 38;2;r;g;b supported in collect_sgr_color semicolon branch

mintty.notes: SGR 38;2;r;g;b and 48;2;r;g;b fully implemented at termout.c:2214-2222 and 2273-2285

xterm.notes: SGR 38:2::r:g:b (ISO-8613-6 standard format) supported. Requires OPT_DIRECT_COLOR for true 24-bit, otherwise uses closest palette match

kitty.notes: ITU T.416 format with colon separators

wezterm.notes: Implemented via SGR 38:2::r:g:b with optional colorspace parameter - see wezterm-escape-parser/src/csi.rs:2488-2522

vte.notes: SGR 38:2::r:g:b supported in collect_sgr_color colon branch

konsole.notes: SGR 38:2::r:g:b / 48:2::r:g:b / 58:2::r:g:b with optional color space ID in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:583-594

mintty.notes: SGR 38:2::r:g:b and 48:2::r:g:b implemented at termout.c:2224-2239 and 2287-2314 (ISO/IEC 8613-6 T.416 format with colon separators)

xterm.notes: No evidence of SGR 58;5;n support in source code or documentation

alacritty.notes: SGR 58;5;n - parameter 58 explicitly listed in escape_support.md

vte.notes: SGR 58;5;n supported via DECO_SPEC in collect_sgr_color

windows_terminal.notes: SGR 58;5;n via UnderlineColor (58) with 256-color index support

konsole.notes: SGR 58;5;n handled in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:602-605, stored via setULColor in src/Screen.cpp:1726

mintty.notes: SGR 58:5:n implemented at termout.c:2319-2324 using colon-separated sub-parameters (ISO/IEC 8613-6 format)

xterm.notes: No evidence of SGR 58;2;r;g;b support in source code or documentation

vte.notes: SGR 58;2;r;g;b supported via DECO_SPEC in collect_sgr_color

windows_terminal.notes: SGR 58;2;r;g;b via UnderlineColor (58) with RGB color support

konsole.notes: SGR 58;2;r;g;b handled in src/Vt102Emulation.cpp:575-594, stored via setULColor

mintty.notes: SGR 58:2:r:g:b implemented at termout.c:2325-2333 using colon-separated sub-parameters (ISO/IEC 8613-6 format)
